primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in a dying world by raising Jesus from the dead, an act that is 'over against all human understanding' and reverses the decree of death.

tekstueel_bewijs: Something utterly new and unlooked for has been done by God
God who 'calls into existence the things that do not exist'
The decree has been set aside [by God] in Christ

object.identificatie: Resurrection (The reversal of death/The New Creation)
tekstueel_bewijs: World-transforming view of our Lord’s victory
The Biblical story of creation tells how... God decreed death. But the decree has been set aside.
Propel us out into a much more world-transforming view
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver of a staggering, terrifying gift.

tekstueel_bewijs: The preacher is... one who testifies to the truth
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; Christ is the Mediator/Victor.
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicit as the gift of faith that allows 'knowing' the Resurrection.

tekstueel_bewijs: Resistance to the real message... is deeply entrenched
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Death is treated as a 'Heavy Opponent'—a decree and a power that human nature cannot overcome through 'renewal' or 'revival'.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response to the Resurrection: moving from fear/bewilderment to witness and joy.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer/The Women
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (human response) is entirely dependent on the success of the primary program (God's act).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God wants it to be in our time
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We extend a very special welcome
We have robbed the angel’s announcement

voorbeelden: Christian believers are going to have to work much harder
What do you suppose they were thinking?
I don’t 'know' it exactly... It is a gift of faith
God who 'calls into existence the things that do not exist'
Wrested supremacy away from them forever

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Power-to-do' (Resurrection) in the face of human 'Inability-to-do'.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from ~S1 (Spring/Bunnies) to S2 (The Grave) to S1 (Resurrection).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God's 'unlooked-for reversal' which is not a natural process but a divine interruption.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; death is described as 'the furrows of the grave' and a 'torment'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is aggressively theocentric. It rejects human 'renewal' in favor of divine 'resurrection'.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Christian believers are going to have to work much harder to understand the difference

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as sole agent of salvation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Resurrection means that something utterly new and unlooked for has been done by God
There is nothing in nature that could have prepared them for the Resurrection.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The women are not models of faith but models of human inability and terror.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The women's fear proves the Resurrection is an act of God, not a human idea.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the burden of 'self-renewal' is removed.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative is tightly focused on the ontological gap between nature and grace.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'terror' of Mark's ending and the 'joy' of Easter.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Wrested supremacy away from them forever... Death is swallowed up in victory.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is implied as the source of the 'gift of faith'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin/Death is a 'decree' that requires a 'world-overturning' act to set aside.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative program.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it serves the Easter context.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The sermon could slightly more explicitly link the 'gift of faith' to the Holy Spirit's work.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in theocentric preaching. It refuses to allow the hearer to become the Subject of the Resurrection story.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'greeting card' imagery; semiotics reveals that these images function as 'Opponents' to the divine Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Mark 16:8; semiotics shows how the 'terror' of the women functions to preserve God's agency.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas' model exposes that 'renewal' and 'resurrection' are not synonyms but represent different actantial engines (Natural Process vs. Divine Intervention).

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Strange Ending' of Mark to dismantle human competence.
